poem:
### Gray's Illusion

A name in the margins,  
Sue Gray—unseen hues of power  
dress her in shadow.  
Emma's jest paints light  
on bureaucracy's hidden scaffold—  
a laugh in the echo  
of corridors long and dull.  
Mirrored reflections blur;  
where truth was a whisper,  
a blabbermouth sings.  
Both are veils,  
one of silence, one of jest.
